name: Herk en Stade
description: Nice park spot in quiet residential area. 7 parking spaces available.  No charge for overnight.  Toilet emptying.   Water & elec at small fee.  Toilet block on site. Pub/restr short walk down road, but we didn't try it.

name: Brugge I Old Town
description: Free Parking just next to the street. Very loud due the traffic at daytime. Nice view to the waterfront and very close to the old town. OK for one or two nights.

name: Camperspot Vogelzanglaan
description: near expo buildings. No toilet no shower. Price €10,40 per night (2 persons and car), To citycenter: Bus 22 to Groenplaats and tram 2 or 6 to Central Station

name: Parking La Roche
description: Bushcamp on the parking in front of official campsite. Walking distance to village

name: Uzbek Embassy
description: Uzbek embassy in Brussels

name: Parking/Campersite
description: Just out of downtown (about 1 km) Brugge, at the yacht club are camper places for small and big rigs. It's also a big bus station. The price is € 25,00 per day/24 hours it's include electricity. Big rigs can park at the end of the bus station, but it's without electricity. At the yacht club is a restaurant. It's a easy walk to downtown.

name: Official Free Camping
description: Free official camping next to the river and 5 min walk from town market square

name: Blaarmeersen Camping
description: Probably the closest campsite to Ghent.  A little tatty and noisy by the road but good to walk or cycle the 4km to the city.

name: Camping Memling, Brugges
description: Nice clean campsite only 3km from centre of Brugges.  Wifi is rubbish however- terrible signal and 1 hour tickets

name: Camping Jeugdstadion (Ypres)
description: Small campsite.  Good value but you will be close to your neighbours.  Wifi slow.  Very close to town.

name: Hermans Family - overlanders
description:
Being Overlanders ourselfs (we travelled South America as a family in 2016 -2017), we welcome all overlanders travelling in Europe! Be our guests!
Whatsapp: +32494888446
Email: barbaradergent@yahoo.com

name: ACS
description: Shipping Agent used by ITS Transport for container shipment from Colombia to Europe.

name: Lac de la Platte Taille, not far from the lake.
description:
Small but nice place in the forest! 
Place for five or six small rigs (Defender/Landcruiser).

name: camping officiel arlon
description: Good spot for a stop over or relaxed stay. Washing and tumble dryer for clothes. Many car services close to camp site.

name: Bertrix p rue du babinay
description:
Near forest
Stone table for eating

Place for campfire

Near an old quarry

name: Ethiopian Embassy
description:
Visa on the spot. 
I went for a 6 month multi entry, 72 EUR.

name: Maboge 24h wildcamp
description:
A pretty grassy and quiet spot next to the river Ourthe, for max. 50 vehicles (campers/overlanders). Overnight stay allowed - max. 24 hours and free of charge.

From la Roche en Ardenne Drive 6 km past all the huge campsites to find the spot at Maboge village.

name: Harelbeke
description: 8 spots for campers on asphalt. You pay 5 euro per camper. Water, electricity and wifi are included. There are sport facilities next to the spot. You can use the toilets free of charge during opening hours. Showering costs 1,25 pp. It seems you can park outside the fence without any problems if the place is full. Perfect place for a stop over!

name: Blegny Mine
description: 24 h free at an old Mine site. Visits possible

name: Arlon
description: Next to the firestation. Free. 600 m from centre.

name: Fishing club
description: This is a parking lot next to some fishing ponds. It's an ideal and quite place to overnight.

name: De Kluisberg
description: Parking lot near the Kluisberg. There ares some nice trails you can walk here. Beautiful view on top of the Kluisberg.

name: Race Track Terlaemen
description: This is a huge parking at the Racetrack of Terlaemen-Zolder. Perfect place to eat, sleep and overnight. There are also other spots around the racetrack where you can park and sleep.

name: immigration
description: This is the place to go before boarding and after disembarking.

name: Agent Grimaldi
description: To embark for America from the south after moving to immigration

name: Zillebeke (+Informal Campsite)
description: Here you can park overday and overnight, there is trash bins, potable water, dumping station. I think the price is 8 euros/day. Beautiful lake, Tearoom at walk distance. Ieper is a beautiful medieval town, highly recommended. Just awesome site.

name: Camping Maka
description: Outdoor camping with a great overlanding spirit by the owners.

name: Bouillon Recreation Area
description:
A site especially for motorhomes. Free of charge. Quiet. However there is a small building with occasional daytime generator-like noise. Room for lots of motorhomes. Near river and forest.

For electricity, you need special coins which you can get at a "tourist house" — wherever that house is.

name: Grillplatz
description: Quiet place with a firepit and some tables, very close to the old railway, now used as a bike way (Vennbahn). Stayed one night with my Rooftop Tent. Friendly People and a small river nearby

name: Thieu
description: A nice location directly situated along the canal near water locks in the heart of the village. Free of charge. Room for 15-20 rigs. No amenities.

name: Sixtusbos  Westvleteren
description: A nice spot with a beautiful view and it is very peaceful. The abby of westvleteren is +- 400 m away. Their you can taste the best trappist of belgium.

name: Wiesenbach
description:
Camping with cottages and places for a rather small number of tents, caravans and campers. Each place is surrounded by hedges. Swimming pool next to  campground (extra fee). Adequate showers and toilets, but only one dish washing sink (in the ladies section) and no laundry facilities. Good WiFi.
fee= € 15 (2 adults, camper).

name: La Roche en Ardenne
description: Really nice Ardenne Village to go by bike from the overnight stop in Maboge

name: Auberge de la jeunesse
description:
Motorhome area in the enclosed car park of the youth hostel. Service area. Drainage on the ground gray water, Drainage black water, water, electricity, breakfast included. € 30 the first night, € 25 the next. Very nice home. Quiet and secure in the heart of Brussels. Metro 10 minutes walk. Max. 10m. 5 places max.

Aire de camping-car sur le parking clos de l'auberge de la jeunesse. Aire de service. Vidange au sol eau grise, Vidange eaux noires, eau, électricité, petit déjeuner inclus. €30 la première nuit, €25 les suivantes. Accueil très sympa. Calme et sécurisant en plein Bruxelles. Métro à 10mn à pieds. Pl maxi 10m. 5 places maxi.

name: Puurs Camperspot Free Camp
description: RV parking, with dumpstation and potable water. Free, maximum stay 48 hours, 5 large parking spots available, paved. Every spot is exually a combination of 4 normal parkingspots. 5 minute walk to the center, with Delhaize supermarket. Easy access for all rigs. Peaceful and quiet. Water only from April first to October 15-th.

name: bois de Biolin
description: Can park in the forest close to the bbq houses, lots of trekkers during summertime (tents)

name: Double BVBA
description: Campsite with warm showers for €1.50 and an excellent shop with everything you could possibly want for camping/overlanding.

name: Mont St Aubert
description:
Petit parking isolé, éloigné de la circulation au milieu des bois. top  


Small car park far from the traffic in the middle of the woods

name: Camping de Molen
description: Camping with wifi, toilets and showers, in low season its not easy to get in, the car taker is not often ther, but if you speak with the permanent camper the let you in and you pay if he is there. Price for a rv with 2 people is 18euro. Be careful if your car hasn't euro 6, antwerben has a "umweltzone" and the campground is inside.you have to register on www.lez.antwerpen.be And pay per day that you drive 35 euro

name: Kalmthoutse Heide
description:
Free camping place only for campers and 4x4. About 10 spots. You can buy water at a tap for €1/100 liter. And there are some electricity plugs.
Maximum time to stay is 48 h.
Some shades.
Next to restaurant.
Across the mainroad you can walk in to the Kalmthoutse heide nature park. (free entrance) for nice marked walks.

name: Zwarteberg
description: Its not the most beautiful place on earth and its close to highway, but who knows Belgium also knows that to find privacy away from others eyes is hard. Woods and privacy thats exaxtly what you can expect from this place. If you drive deep on the grvel/muddy route you can turn behind the small forrest and you are hidden for good. When rainy maybe the route is muddy, but I didnt have any issues even after three days rain. I came in the evening and stayed till 9am with no issues at all. Maybe only the noise from highway is bad, but for one night more than good if you like to be in green and not to stay in concrete parking lot elswhere in centre if towns.

name: Le vedeur
description:
Motorhome campground close the old village of Durbuy. Sites along the river. Clean toilet and hot showers. 

Paid €10 for the camper + €5,5 p.p. Incl electricity and water

name: Parkheide
description: Parking lot associated with restaurant and kids playground.

name: parking at osbroek park
description:
ADMINISTRATOR NOTE: be aware that wild camping in general is illegal in Belgium.

We spent a quite night here. no problems at all but no facilities. parking lots under huge trees next to the sports club. you can walk through the big park or play soccer on the field.

name: Pays de Herve Information
description:
Tourist information in Herve with Restaurant and Souvenir shop. It's next to the cycle route between Lüttich and Aachen (Ligne 38, Eurovelo 3) Toilets, Water, Picnic area and Showers. Toilets and warm Showers are only open during opening hours. April tru September Mo-Fr 9-18 Uhr and Weekend 10-18 Uhr
October tru March Mo-Fr 9-17 Uhr and Weekend 10-17
Showers are free just 5€ Caution and your Passport

name: Tour & Taxi
description: Wide open space in middle of city. The guard even provided us with free electricity.

name: Just a field
description: camped here at a raw field next to some barn which seems to be unoccupied. at the end of an dirt road. did that by motorbike and tent. for tent this place is good so far, probably also for 4x4 rig, big rigs may have problems with the narrow street and probably attract too much attention

name: Klein Strand
description:
A big campground for all vehicles. August was 25€ per tent. With a lake, kids pool, Bar, Restaurant, gambling hall.
Close to highway (sound).

name: Biolin woods
description:
a place where it is  allowed to stay for  one night. only tents, place for parking your car.  firepit, bbq, and pick nick .
quiet road next to it.

name: Picnic Area
description: picnic area and barbecue - national forest of fesches. parking place where you can BBQ for free. lots of parking space and picknick tables.

name: Citadel de Namur Car Park
description: No parking fees, up on the hill next to the citadel you get a great view of the city. Going up the hill to get here is steep and has a bumpy brick road.

name: Parking De Schalk
description:
big parking lot which is used frequently by locals with RV's
no problem to stay overnight. no amenities

name: Camping YPRA
description: €20 per night for two people with a 4WD and roof top rent including power. Beautiful green grass on the pitches. Highly recommended. This is a large camp site with permanent vans but also loads of space for camper vans and camping areas. It has great facilities and the most friendly owners.

name: City of Tournai
description: Parking for motorhomes, in the center of the city. Parking, water and sanitation dump station are free.

name: Uri Dam Free Camp
description: Big parking lot next to the dam special and free for campervans. There start a small hike (30min) and a long hike (4h). Not so much sun because of the “valley”. Lot of rats. Ok for one night.

name: Island Spot
description: Spot at the end of the road on an island. Beautiful view at the river. We had a great silent night with friends here.

name: aire de bivouac des traqueurs
description:
fire pit
camping ground
no water 
sometimes dirty,  chairs ect
good for bbq

name: Wepion
description:
quiet parking with view of the meuse and seen by no one except a few residents. No amenities. close to all shops, even on foot. Safe place.
---
parking au calme avec vue sur meuse et vu de personne sauf de quelques riverains. Aucunes commodités. à proximité de tous les commerces même à pied. Endroit sûr.

name: Bicycle camping / free camping for cyclists
description:
Radfahrer auf Reisen mit Zelt und APE Camper für eine Übernachtung willkommen. Bitte vor Ankunft telefonisch anmelden unter Whatsapp 0049 15775843475. Der Platz ist begrenzt.
Cyclists and APE Campers welcome for overnight stays when traveling with a tent. Please register by phone on arrival at Whatsapp 0049 15775843475. Space is limited.

name: Beautiful spot at the coastline
description: Great place to stay before shipping out of Zeebrugge. We stayed here for a couple of days and had no problems. There is a water tap on one of the buildings we drank it without any problems. Small shop and butcher only a short walk. It's a very nice and clean town with  friendly locals.

name: camper plaats de wissen
description: parking lot style camper spot with some grass around it.

name: Pierard car rescue
description:
hello, this is my personal garage. I am also an overlander and therefore if you need a helping hand I can make my garage available with all the tools and order parts for you.
my number phone 0032483051732
my email lionelcollette.lc@gmail.com

name: Pierard car rescue
description:
hello, this is my garage is my warehouse. I am also overlander and if you need to store a vehicle in case of a problem you can store a vehicle here safely.
my phone 0032483051732
my email lionelcollette.lc@gmail.com

name: pierard car rescue
description:
hello, this is my garage and warehouse. I am also overlander and if you need to take a shower or fill up with water or anything you can contact me with pleasure. I will be very happy to help you.
my phone 0032483051732
my email lionelcollette.lc@gmail.com

name: Balthasard
description: Wonderful place to have breakfast, tea, etc. Waffles, bowls, milkshakes etc.

name: Vallee de la hoëgne
description: Start of a nice and easy walk. You can spend the night here. We did in our van. Calm at night. By the river.

name: Wenduine, de Molen
description: I was here with my tent 4 days..  I could leave my tent behind, without worrying.  It is an open spot, still it's in between trees. Not 1 person passed me these 4 days.  Because across this spot and street is a beautiful park with a path to very nice, quiet beach area. Quite spot next to the beach, public transport for exploring even more beauty at the Belgian Coastline

name: Next to the beach
description: Great spot for a night. It's really quiet.  in between parking spot and the Beach at Lombardsijde (Middelkerke) I was here 2 nights alone. After my first night, I did all my stuff back in my backpack, then hidden this in the buches so I could go exploring not carrying my stuff. when I came back during the evening nothing changed. So I set my tent up again. You can hear the sea at night, which is so relaxing.  Nobody knew I ever was here. Could stay longer, but wanted to explore next town at the Belgian coast.

name: Near river Amblève
description: Near the town of Cheneux/ Manceau, nice little place near the river. You can camp under the railway bridge when bad weather. (no trains at night, few during day) Very quiet. You can see the railroad bridge from the road, then take a small country road for about 200 meters.

name: Overlanders bivouac
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: Description provided by owner or manager. 

Private ground/garden accepting one or two 4x4 cars and trucks for free overnight. Camp fire location. Dry toilet.Pets and children welcome. Electricity provided 5€\24h. Please inform if planing an overnight by mail: landrover88@mac.com, before arrival.

name: Petrem
description:
Parking Rugby stadium. very quiet. Beautiful location.
......

Parking Rugby stadium zeer stil . Prachtige lokatie

name: Bivak Grootbos Genoelselderen
description: Wooden platforms with a capacity of max 4 tents. Has a biotoilet, no water. Its a campingspot (bivak) where you can stay legal for a few nights (tents only). Located into the woods and nearby a wine castle.

name: Bivak Grootbos Genoelselderen
description: in forest. near wine castle. free, legal camping spot (bivak).

name: Chateau Weiland
description:
Accessibility:
This camp is only accessible by bike. In the street next to the castle, there are parking spaces specially for 'Reis naar de boer'.
The avenue in which the meadow is located is historically protected and therefore motorized vehicles are prohibited. You can park your car in the adjacent Kasteelstraat on the reserved spaces.

In the heart of Zulte (Olsene) you can stay on the pasture of Didier and Patrick. They give you a warm welcome to Chateau Meadow, a meadow near the beautiful castle of Olsene.
In the extension of the castle you can find a historic lane where 'Chateau Weiland' is located.

For activities in the area you can take a look at the website of Tourism Leiestreek!

Accessibility:

This camp is only accessible by bike. In the street next to the castle, there are parking spaces specially for 'Reis naar de boer'.

The avenue in which the meadow is located is historically protected and therefore motorized vehicles are prohibited. You can park your car in the adjacent Kasteelstraat on the reserved spaces.

name: De vallei hoeve
description:
Ghislain and his family are pleased to welcome you to their beautiful farm in the heart of Lievegem. Located on the edge of the Old Bald Valley, the meadow is the ideal starting point for walking or cycling tours. Discover the region and enjoy the peace and quiet on the meadow.

Interested in the farm itself? Be sure to visit Ghislain and he will gladly take you on a tour of his yard and beautiful vegetable garden!

For activities in the area check out the website of Tourism Meetjesland!

Accessibility

This site is also accessible for campers and caravans. WHEN BOOKING, PLEASE SEND A SEPARATE EMAIL WITH THE NOTIFICATION OF THE CAMPER OR CARAVAN VIA info@reisnaardeboer.be.

Cars can come to the meadow and park nearby. We ask, however, for the sake of safety to ensure that the roads always remain clear!

name: Blegny Mine Parking
description: Parking lot of Blegny Mine. Quiet but no facilities, just two little trash containers. With the pandemic, the Blegny Mine is closed. Nice morning view.

name: Berismenil
description:
Magnificent secluded location with magnificent 360 ° view
A starting point for hikes
No protection in high winds
Super calm

name: Spring water ‘Bronneke’
description: Water tap to fill up water. Local farmers also use this tap. Forbidden to use at nighttime between 22h00 till 7h00. Drinkable after cooking.

name: Herfurth Logistics
description: Herfurth Logistics is a shipping agent that can help you get your container out of Antwerp port. I guess they can also send it for you but I only worked with them for retrieving my truck.

name: Baalse Hei
description: Campsite where you can rent a tracking cabin, several sizes tents and several sizes trailers. Free wifi. Large cafeteria/reastaurant, swimming pond.

name: Baalse Hei
description: Campsite where you can rent a tracking cabin, several sizes tents and several sizes trailers. Free wifi. Large cafeteria/reastaurant, swimming pond.

name: Lilse Bergen
description: Large scale camping site, with tracking cabins, tents, safari tents, caravans. Large swimming pond, restaurant, small store, laundromat.

name: Refugee ex-campsite
description: There used to be a big campsite that now serves as refugee shelter. I dropped by because the website is still online. Could not stay on site, but the very friendly guard/housekeeper/caretaker let me camp on the parking space outside and use the toilet and kitchen. Perfect for the night if you don't want to wander off into the woods anymore.

name: Near Meuse River
description:
Space for three campers with a view of the fields, not far from the Meuse River
......
plaats voor drie camper met zicht op de velden, niet ver van de Maas.

name: Ramonsshowk 25
description: Informal campground run by people with a great heart for overlanders, camptrucks and 4x4’s

name: Forest
description: Parking lot in the forest. Allowed to stay for the night.

name: Camp Bonanza
description: Extensive campground with a variety of sites from big rig to tent. Paid 27 euros for a two people with a caravan (truck camper). Hookups and wifi available for additional cost. Clean toilet and shower facilities, showers additional cost of 2 euros. Most sites close together without any landscaping separation. We camped in the field without hookups. One mile walk to the beach.

name: Camping Groenpark
description: Pleasant campground 30 mins from Gent on the way to Antwerp. Grassy spots, hookups available, clean shower and toilet facilities. Paid 27 Euros for two people with camper truck. Wifi available and excellent service on Google Fi. Short walk to lake or groceries.

name: Camping Houtum
description: Classic Belgium style small campground. Grassy field spaces with electric and water hookups available. Free Wifi, clean bathroom building with showers for a fee. Cafe on site. Contacted them through their website in advance to request a booking, very responsive. Paid 17 euro for a camper site with two people.

name: Street parking
description: In front of Grand Hotel Casselbergh, we have a small car and we parked here for one night. There’s a lot of people passing by since we’re just next to the center place. But good for one night

name: Parc d’amée
description:
Very quiet place on the road to your final destination.
Nice park in front, great for kids and dogs.

name: canal Gent-Terneuzen.
description: Several simple spots along the west side. Boats, barges and several large industrial operations. Smell sometimes. Not very quiet, but funny.

name: l'Hermitage de Wachet.
description: Serene place in the woods. last 100mtr dirt road. small well-kept chapel. Please don't go all of you at the same time. It's too beautiful to overrun.

name: Sahara Parking
description:
A quiet parking lot with a gravel surface, in between the forest and the canal. In the weekend over 6 campers camped here, so it’s probably okay to do so. Even on weekdays, it's packed.

The parking is the start for several hikes in the Lommelse Sahara.

name: Koksijde Airfield camper and van
description: New and official camper and van parking spot. No anemities. Just next to the Koksijde military airfield with great view. Very calm at night, only bikers during the day.  Fantastic view. 12 hours camping max

name: LPG Techniek Van Meenen
description: A great store that has everything LPG related. Fair prices and excellent knowhow.

name: Dead-end agricultural road
description:
Dead-end road for smaller vans only. Hardly impossible to turn with larger camper but smaller vans will be fine. In the midst of agriculture fields and next to military airstrip. 15 minutes walk to center of Veurne.
Except for an occasional dog owner you will be all alone here.

name: Parking Ecluse
description: Quiet place for parking overnight, only vehicles, no commodities.

name: Parking Saint-Hubert
description: Sanitary dump station - Water - Three parking spots - Free

name: Raeren
description: Quiet spot in the woods to park, no facilities.

name: Kelmis
description: Overnight parking allowed - Electricity - Water - Sanitation dump station

name: Merkemveld Forest
description: Lots of places for informal camping, most often used by scouts etc.

name: Sportpark Terwilgen
description:
Official overnight parking without any services. Pizza place just across the street. 
Brussels 10 km. away.

name: Paddenbroek camperplaces
description:
The Town of Gooik provides 3 places for campers to spent the night. The stay is legal and is for free. Also you don't need a reservation. The toilets in the cultural center can be used during the opening hours of the Cycling and Walking Café.

Stay is limited to a maximum of 24 hours.

name: Camping La prahay
description:
Nice quiet camping along the semois with nice owners.
Good sanitation 
Wifi
Bar/restaurant

name: Aalter Motorhome Stop
description: Free Motorhome stop in the small town of Aalter. Water fill-up available here for €1. Cafe across the street is open from 08:30 to 20:00 with great coffee and cakes, as well as a very nice loo. Great 4G signal, good enough for video conferencing.

name: Ancienne carrière de Resteigne
description: Along the river Lesse and near  the Forest, quiet spot for the night. No commodities

name: outdoor camping barvaux
description: nice small camping with focus on outdoor actifity

name: bivakplaats solt
description: a small place in the forrest for a couple off tents or a small vehicle, there is a composting toilet, water pump (the water is not drinkable), a bench, a small platform, a fireplace, it is verry quiet. there are also hooks in poles for 2 hammocks.

name: Forêt outside liège
description:
Place quiet to have rest.
Not for ten cause of lack of space and rocks

name: camping Groeneverde
description:
Small and nice campground with grassy areas lots of trees around, kids area, rustic but clean sanitaries, bar.
Friendly owners. You can use bikes for free.
Calm place, close to Gand city. 

30€/ night for 2 adults, 2 kids, tent, car and dog. Electricity, wifi and hot water included.
Kids under 12 years free.

name: camping des lacs
description:
Nice camping with lot of shadow, near to the main road but quiet at night. Small bar/restaurant. 
Pets friendly. Small but cleans sanitaries.  
Paid 45€ / night for tent, 2 adults, 2 kids, 1 dog and electricity.
1km from a beach. Free small train around lake.

name: Natura Parc
description:
Super parc accrobranche à côté de la plage. 27€/pers pour 6 parcours environ 3h.

Nice adventure park next to the beach. 27€/pax for 6 trips in trees, during more and less 3 hours.

name: Lille Fort
description:
parkinglot on the border of the river De Schelde. In an old fort of Napoleon. few bars/restaurants in the village. you can take the riverbus to Doel and Antwerp.
Some backround noise of the industrie, you are in the middle of Port of Antwerp. you can pitch a tent but wildcamping is not legal in Belgium.

name: Canal Nimy-Blaton-Peronnes
description: Next to the canal where ships can moor you can park your camper.

name: Barrage du Ri de Rome
description:
Small car park next to the Lac du Ri de Rome water treatment plant.
Very quiet, almost no cars pass by and there are rubbish bins available.

name: bastogne
description: parking near the war museum. entrance 5 euro. a lot of space,  good for 24 hour. visit the museum go for a hike,  sleep. a walk from the center. start point of 2 hike trails.

name: Belgium Zutendaal, campsite
description: Great hospitality. Camp in a small field between horses. Quiet. Clean Wc and shower. Good price. 10 minutes from the motorway and supermarket, friteur and cafes.

name: leuze
description:
LPG station where you can fill bottles of all types, staff not very friendly, €27 for 13 kgs, the attendant fills the bottle himself, you have to take it out of the camper


station lpg où l'on peut remplir les bouteilles de tous types,  personnel pas trés sympa, 27€ pour 13 kgs, le préposé remplis la bouteille lui meme, il faut la sortir du camping car

name: Overland motorcycle shop
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: Description provided by owner or manager.

All-Road Moto is strong in minor repairs because of our well-equipped and open workshop. We can provide spare parts for all brands on demand and do tire changes as well. Still a real old school garage! Allroadmoto grew out of an extreme passion for traveling on paved & unpaved roads. If the customer wishes, we can prepare their bike (any brand) completely in-house.

We receive customers, share stories, try on products in a relaxed atmosphere. Just come by to have a free coffee or a soft drink and meet fellow travellers!

name: (i)Overlander's house
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: Description provided by owner or manager.

Being overlanders ourselves, we welcome travellers, including hikers and bicyclists (see https://welcometomygarden.org), in our garden and house (for free).

There is place for a few small tents in the garden overlooking the valley, overlander vehicles and big rigs (in an adjacent, rougher terrain). We have WiFi, water and a bathroom for guests.

It's not a wild camping site: please do contact us before coming over at isad@choam.com or +32 80 319 913.

name: Oudenaarde - Belgium - Flandern
description: Oudenaarde - Parking area at the river - 10 Minutes to centre - 10 places for big Riggs - Quiet at night

name: Overnight parking Bredene
description:
Large parking lot 7PM until 10AM free of charge - no prohibition sign for campers - we had space at the beginning of April and no problem with the overnight stop

Großer Parkplatz 19-10 Uhr kostenlos - kein Verbotsschild für Camper - wir hatten Anfang April Platz und kein Problem beim overnight stop

name: Overnight parking Gent
description:
Overnight parking Gent
Big parking area at a Event centre closed by a barrier.
2 € per day.
4 km to the city.

name: Pondside Camping
description: Awesome little spot. It’s on private property but there are several little individual spots for small campers. Nice view and a peaceful quiet night. About as good as you can get for a “wild” camp around these parts. Of course no services.

name: 76 Bus
description:
Small concrete parking area by roundabout. Quiet with a little shade.
You can catch a 76 bus into Ghent, pay with card.
Large enough for a big rig (ours is 8m expedition truck) or 2 motorhomes. Don't leave any rubbish to spoil this nice spot! Stayed one night.

name: Chatelet
description: Car park near hospital and ring road. OK for a night.

name: Paddenbroek Campervan parking
description: Right next to the Paddenbroek cultural center are three legal parkingspots for campers. You are allowed to stay here for free for 24h. During the opening times of the center you can use the toilette. There is a nice bar with terrass at Paddenbroek. And numerous walking and biking routes you can do. You can find more information on: https://www.gooik.be/vrije-tijd/toerisme/plattelandscentrum-paddenbroek

name: Swarte
description:
Public parking with dry toilets. A lot of room, no sign “no overnight”.
Tram in front of the parking. 
Beach in front of the spot.

name: Tro Do Way Campsite
description:
Beautiful campsite along the creek. ~30 places.
Located in the valley, surrounded by forest.
Phone reception is limited, but wifi is available

name: Les Brullins
description: Communal campsite of static homes but 4 grassy  pitches for visiting campers. Local bar/restaurant within walking distance.

name: Aire de Motorhomes, Tournai
description:
12 paved, flat marked pitches for motorhomes run by City. Parking from 12noon to 12 following day. 10€ includes electricity and water. Also disposal of grey water and chemical waste. Access is via a scanned code and email. Quick and easy.
Walking distance to Cathedral. Great initiative by city.

name: moerbeke
description:
Nice motorhome for max 24 hours. parking lot for starting hiking trails

Fijne camperplaats voor max 24 uur. parkeerplaats voor start wandelroutes

name: Auberge de jeunesse de Tournai
description:
Price more than correct 27euros for dormitory and breakfast and well located
---
Bonne acceuil. Prix plus que correct 27euros pour dortoir et petit déjeuner et bien situé

name: camping de la cascade
description:
super camping next to a river. well kept shower/toilet/cleaning area. public fire pit and inside chill room with bar. €22-€35 high season, elctricity xtra.
worth the money for tired muscles.

name: Overnight camp
description: Over night camp outside Brussels. In the woods. Lots of birds

name: Bivakzone Galgenhof (Free)
description:
Bikes only!!

What is a bivac zone?
 
A recognized, legal place in nature where you can spend the night briefly, without luxury and discreetly in your own tent.  Intended for those who travel on foot or by bicycle, not by car.  Start from the basic idea that you can only use a piece of land where you can legally pitch your trekking tent for one or two nights.  Any comfort facilities present, such as a water point, shelter or fire ring are included as an extra but no guarantee.  You stay there according to the 'leave no trace' principle and without disturbing the natural environment.
 
 What isn't it?
We dQe 
A free campsite that you can reach by car.  You can't go there in a group either.  For comfort facilities and a feeling of home, it is better to move to a campsite, where your waste will be cleaned up after your stay.  In a bivouac zone you bear your own responsibility.  Just as you leave the bivouac zone after a night's stay, it is also offered to the bivouac who comes after you.

name: Parking Spot Next to hiking Route
description:
Big parking spot, next to a hiking route at the Forest. Here is an area for dogs to run free.
It wasn‘t so quiet because there is a soccer field, but at Night it was ok.

name: Parking de pêche-Thy le Château
description: Nice little fisherman parking spot next to the "Eau d'Heure" a small river. Place for 3 vans on gravel. Very quiet,  in the middle of the fields and close to a bush. One garbage bin on site.

name: E40 southbound near Brussels
description: A services with toilets, shower, shop and fast food. Camping overnight permitted and it’s quieter on the far side of the services

name: Peace Woods
description:
Parking.
Very quiet place.
No facilities, good mobile network.
Access via narrow paved road.

name: Broeltorens parking
description: Official parking with separate section for campers and overlanders - walking distance to city center - charge Euro 15 per night

name: De Bonterie
description: De Bonterie is located on an active dairy farm in Keiem-Diksmuide, a stone's throw from the Belgian coast. You park between the dairy cattle that graze in the nearby. 9 camper pitches with their own electricity and a garden with a beautiful view. There are paved lanes. There is a central discharge point for gray water and a chemical toilet, as well as a water tap and waste collection point.

name: Graveyard of the Skull
description:
Beautifull old Graveyard.
Original Name: Central Cemetery Bruges-Assebroek
There you can find ta Grave with a stone Skull.
Also there are toilets and water available.

name: Ypern
description:
A lovely hidden parking lot very close to the centre. Free of charge, but some blue lines are still there.
Table, bins & little lake!
